title: ACIP meeting postponed, for reasons that are unclear
summary: And other health news from today's Morning Rounds newsletter

title: AI is slashing jobs across industries. Will pharma be next?
summary: Despite a wave of AI-fueled layoffs, the pharma and biotech industries could be spared from massive cutbacks for now.

title: With federal research funding uncertain, states debate new science initiatives
summary: A handful of states are considering initiatives to increase funding for scientific research as uncertainty around federal dollars has grown.

title: Biohackers and wellness influencers are pushing nicotine as part of their ‘stacks’
summary: As smoking rates fall in the U.S., startups and influencers are pushing the purported cognitive and health benefits of indulging in nicotine.

title: Would you trust AI to renew your drug prescriptions?
summary: Would you trust AI to renew your drug prescriptions? Alex Hogan explores the question on this week's episode of STATus Report.

title: Opinion: On ‘The Pitt,’ art catches up with the medical debt crisis
summary: Joe Sachs, a physician and executive producer on “The Pitt,” and the CEO of Undue Medical Debt weigh in on the show’s foray into a health care crisis.

title: Opinion: STAT+: Sometimes, it would be unethical not to use AI in medicine
summary: “We do not let pilots fly without instrument support simply because they technically could. Why should medicine be different?”

title: STAT+: Texas attorney general sues Sanofi for allegedly providing kickbacks to doctors to prescribe its drugs
summary: The Texas AG has filed a lawsuit accusing Sanofi of providing kickbacks to doctors, in the form of a free network of nurses and insurance support services.

title: STAT+: Key study of Grail’s cancer detection test fails in setback for company
summary: Grail's blood test for detecting cancer early failed to meet its main goal in a giant study being conducted with England’s NHS, the company said.

title: STAT+: In first speech to her FDA staff, Høeg says she’ll scrutinize RSV shots and SSRIs in pregnancy
summary: The top drug regulator at the FDA told staff she plans to question the safety of taking SSRIs in pregnancy and of RSV shots given to infants.

title: Hims’ Super Bowl fallout, and the FDA reverses course
summary: Was Hims' Super Bowl ad the final straw for regulators? Is the bar being lowered for psychedelic medicines? And what's happening with Moderna and FDA? Find out on "The Readout…

title: STAT+: FDA taps AI executive to lead digital health center
summary: FDA has tapped a former executive from a health AI company to lead its digital health center.

title: STAT+: The federal directory of doctors and hospitals is coming this year
summary: Patients have long had to navigate error-prone lists of doctors and hospitals.

title: STAT+: 5 powerful people to know at HHS
summary: Find out who's on the rise inside RFK Jr.'s federal health department.

title: Altesa, run by former Trump official, raises $75M for well-traveled lung drug
summary: Led by Brett Giroir and GSK’s ex-chief medical officer, Altesa is advancing a medicine that’s changed hands multiple times and once failed a study in asthma.

title: FDA leaders say one pivotal trial, not two, should be ‘default’ for drug approvals
summary: In a NEJM article, Commissioner Martin Makary and top deputy Vinay Prasad argued that the new policy should lower development costs and speed development without compromising agency standards.

title: STAT+: AI-guided cancer treatments, telehealth usage, and other health tech news
summary: In this edition of STAT Health Tech: A new wave of AI-guided cancer treatments, a Hims acquisition, and other health tech news.

title: STAT+: Pharmalittle: We’re reading about the FDA pushing OTC meds, its new trial standards, and much more
summary: FDA Commissioner Marty Makary said he believes “everything should be over the counter” unless a drug is unsafe, addictive or requires monitoring

title: STAT+: Hims to buy Eucalyptus as it looks to expand globally
summary: Hims & Hers is buying the Australian telehealth firm Eucalyptus as it looks to make inroads in more countries globally.

title: STAT+: What to expect from Gossamer Bio’s late-stage lung disease study
summary: Gossamer Bio will be reporting the outcome of a late-stage study in pulmonary arterial hypertension. Here's what to know.

title: STAT+: 5 key people to watch at HHS after Trump’s shake-up
summary: HHS has elevated a new team of health policy experts, including a former health IT exec and a Trump administration veteran.

title: Opinion: My biggest GLP-1 ethical problem: patients who don’t want to stop
summary: Some GLP-1 patients are begging to stay on the drugs just a little bit longer, presenting an ethical dilemma for doctors.

title: Lilly to pay CSL $100M to license monoclonal antibody targeting IL-6
summary: The Australian company will retain rights for an end-stage kidney disease indication currently being tested in a Phase 3 trial while Lilly explores other uses.

title: FDA accepts BMS protein degrader for review; Disc rare disease drug rejected
summary: Cytokinetics’ heart disease drug secured European approval. Elsewhere, Teva and Sanofi reported longer-term data from an experimental therapy targeting ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease.

title: An Alzheimer’s startup emerges with $175M in venture backing
summary: Backed by Wellington, Sanofi Ventures and a division of J.P. Morgan, Korsana Therapeutics is studying a treatment originally developed by hub-and-spoke biotech Paragon Therapeutics.

title: Psychedelics stocks rise as Compass’ psilocybin drug heads to FDA
summary: Shares of at least four other developers were up by mid-single digits to low-double digits at certain points on Tuesday.

title: FDA reverses course on Moderna’s flu vaccine
summary: In response to a query from BioPharma Dive, an HHS spokesperson said the FDA will “maintain its high standards during drug review and potential licensure stages.”

title: PIP4K2C: an emerging fulcrum for multiple diseases
Compass, with Phase 3 hits, ready to take psilocybin to the FDA
summary: The company plans to meet with the FDA to discuss a rolling approval application for “COMP360,” a synthetic form of psilocybin that could become the first “classic” psychedelic cleared for the U.S.…

title: Ocular claims a win with eye drug data even as shares sink
summary: Investors were looking for a greater difference between Ocular’s experimental medicine and a low-dose version of Eylea, analysts said.
